speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series
text: Pamela Fryman  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Costume Design for a Series

speaker: Outstanding Costume Design for a Series
text: Audrey Bansmer  * * *  ## Transcript {mike lee}    **WHIMSY** _Scene One -- Frasier's Apartment It's Halloween!  The doorbell rings.  Martin opens the door to Niles, wearing a bowler and clenching a cigarette holder in his teeth. _
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series

speaker: Niles
text: Trick or treat!  Or should I say, "Pip Pip!"
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Costume Design for a Series

speaker: Martin
text: What's with the outfit?

speaker: Niles
text: This is part of your costume for tonight.  I just picked it up for you.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  I thought you said you were getting me a Sherlock Holmes outfit.  He didn't wear a bowler.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they were all out of Sherlock Holmes, so I put together something else for you.  Don't worry, it's another detective. Tonight, you'll be Lord Peter Wimsey!

speaker: Martin
text: Who the hell's that?

speaker: Niles
text: He's a celebrated _bon vivant_ sleuth from a series of novels by Dorothy L. Sayers.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not going anywhere where I have to tell people my name's "Wimsey!"  Ah no, forget it, I'm just gonna wear my old police uniform.

speaker: Niles
text: You can't.  It's a Halloween ball for the Library Association, you have to come dressed as a character from literature.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, why didn't I just tell Sherry I'd go with her to visit her mother in prison?

speaker: Niles
text: Come on, Dad, it'll be fun!  I'm going to go as Cyrano de Bergerac--musician, philosopher, fighter, poet! [_he grabs Martin's cane and brandishes it like a rapier_] The greatest friend and the bravest swordsman alive! [_notices_] Eew, what's all over your cane?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  I dropped it in the movie theater last night. _Niles hands the cane back and wipes his palm with his handkerchief. Frasier and Daphne come out, laughing and admiring a set of photos._

speaker: Frasier
text: I love this picture!  You look adorable in that!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I do not!  You just like it because you look so handsome in it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the camera doesn't lie, you know.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you two giggling about?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, we're just looking at the snapshots from our trip to the microbrewery.

speaker: Niles
text: That must have been especially fun for you, Dad. [_looks at some of the photos_] You're not in any of these.

speaker: Martin
text: That's 'cause I didn't go.  That was the day Eddie got into the poison oak.  I was up all night rubbing calamine lotion on his belly.

speaker: Frasier
text: These really are the golden years for you, aren't they?

speaker: Niles
text: So it was just you and Frasier?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes. [_chuckles_] Your brother and I got pretty silly after tasting all that beer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Daphne there's no need to tell Niles _everything_ we did that night.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, we got a bit naughty!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not too naughty, I hope.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, now, now, Dr. Crane, I know what you're thinking.  But not to worry.  After all that drinking, we didn't drive home.  We spent the night in a motel.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that takes a load off my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, uh, what time is this little soiree of yours this evening?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I still got to get the velvet in my slippers re- crushed.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, Dad, I will find you a Sherlock Holmes outfit. [_to Frasier_] Seven P.M.  Which reminds me, I have to get home before Marta arrives to set up.  She's arachnophobic, poor thing.  Last Halloween she beat my centerpiece to bits with a broom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps we should go finish up those costumes, [_British accent_] eh, _waif?_

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: Did you say "wife?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Hasn't your brother told you?  Dr. Crane is going as Geoffrey Chaucer from "The Canterbury Tales", and I'll be dressed as the Wife of Bath!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_accent_] Yes, and a saucy little strumpet she is too!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] Oh, you naughty rogue!  We've been having quite a time talking to each other like that.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, it's been Ye Olde Laugh Riot around here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Join me in my bedchamber, my lord?

speaker: Frasier
text: After you, my juicy wench!

speaker: Niles
text: "My juicy wench?" [_into phone_] No, no, not you, Maris! Wait, wait! [_to Frasier_] I hope you're happy, she's run for her water pills! _Scene Two -- KACL Frasier is doing his show.  The booth is decorated for Halloween--orange and black streamers, jack-o'-lanterns, etc.  Roz is a wreck--she's wearing a dingy sweatsuit, her hair is shabby and unkempt, and she looks exhausted. _

speaker: Roz
text: On line three we have, uh, Ted, who is feeling a little disconnected.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Ted. _Roz pushes a button to connect Ted.  Frasier hears a dial tone.  Roz gasps and covers her mouth with her hands._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I hope Ted appreciates irony.

speaker: Roz
text: On line two we have Bill.  He's going through a very difficult transition.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Bill. Dorothy: [_v.o._] Uh, hello?  Is someone there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I see we're pretty much through our transition, aren't we, Bill? Dorothy: This is Dorothy.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Bill's on line one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, let's just stick with Dorothy for the time being. How can I help you? Dorothy: You can get me Roz.  I'm her manicurist, and she called for an appointment.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll call you back later, Dorothy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps we'd better take a moment to regroup.  I'd like to apologize for the unusually high number of technical difficulties we've experienced today, and now we will go to these public service messages. _Roz looks around her booth for the P.S.A. cart, then realizes she left it in Frasier's booth.  She rushes in and jams it into the player.  Frasier goes off the air._

speaker: Frasier
text: Explain yourself!

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just a little off my game today.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little?

speaker: Roz
text: O.K., a lot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you come in here looking ghoulish even for Halloween, and you sleepwalk your way through my entire show!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh... I'm sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Sorry" just doesn't cut it, Roz!  What possible explanation can there be for this level of unprofessionalism?!

speaker: Roz
text: I think I'm pregnant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pregnant?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I don't know for sure.  I took one of those home tests, and it was kind of iffy, so I went to see my doctor, and he's gonna call me with results.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Roz, how--?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know how!  No one is more careful than I am when it comes to birth control.  But then again, even the best protection is only effective ninety-nine out of a hundred times.  I can't beat those odds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose you've been dodging that bullet for a long time now.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, promise me you won't tell anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course not, Roz.  But frankly, we don't know if we have anything to tell yet.

speaker: Roz
text: What if there is?

speaker: Frasier
text: Then we'll deal with that when we have to.  No use crossing that bridge till we come to it.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't get my mind off it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know Niles's party is tonight.  That should serve as a distraction.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier, I don't think I'm up for that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I did rent a costume and everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: For me?  It'll be fun!  You know you want to.

speaker: Roz
text: That's exactly the kind of talk that got me into this.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, tell your brother I'm coming to his charity thing tonight.  I just found the perfect costume!

speaker: Frasier
text: And as what literary character will you be attending?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Waldo! [_Frasier looks at him blankly_] From "Where's Waldo?" He's like in sixteen books!  You call yourself well-read. _Bulldog exits.  Frasier and Roz share a look.  Scene Three -- The Montana Niles's party is in full swing.  The stereo plays classical music. The living room is filled with guests dressed as a variety of literary characters.  Niles comes down the stairs dressed as Cyrano de Bergerac, right down to the huge nose.  Somewhat incongruously, his cell phone rings. _

speaker: Niles
text: Niles Crane.  Maris!  Where are you?  Still at the beauty parlor?  What--no, calm down, calm down, stop crying.  It can't be as bad as all that.  Exactly how much hair do you have left?  Oh...

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't panic, we just have to find another character for you to be tonight.  Uh, there's an Ionesco play called "The Bald Soprano!" [_chuckles_] No I'm joking, Maris.  What?  You've got to come!  Maris, for God's sake, you have thirty-seven wigs, just go down to the wig vault and pick one!  Maris, this evening means a great deal to me.  I need you here with me. Do you care about my feelings at all? [_Maris hangs up_] Well, that answers that. scene from here on, Niles will be getting progressively drunker_]  Out in the living room, Martin and Daphne come in, dressed as Sherlock Holmes and the Wife of Bath.  They are followed shortly by Frasier, dressed as Geoffrey Chaucer. _

speaker: Frasier
text: So, how's the party?

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, we just got here.  We had a bit of a delay when Sherlock here led us to the wrong apartment.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so we're a minute late.  I noticed you didn't complain when the old lady gave us peanut butter cups.

speaker: Niles
text: Evening, all!  Oh, what lovely costumes!  Daphne, you look particularly beautiful.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thanks.  I'm not sure I agree.  It's a bit tight--must have put on a pound or two.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_accent_] That's enough out of you, you wanton troll, or I'll smite your bawdy backside with the flat of me sinewy right hand!

speaker: Martin
text: At least on the ride over her I could stick my head out the window.  So where's the bar?

speaker: Niles
text: That's right over here, I'm serving grog and mead.

speaker: Martin
text: Which one tastes most like beer? _Niles leads Martin to the bar.  Daphne drifts into the crowd.  Behind Frasier, Roz comes in, wearing fright makeup and a trench coat._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz!  Oh, I'm so glad you came!  Any word from the doctor?

speaker: Roz
text: No, and I am going crazy.  I can't even picture myself as a mother, can you? _She removes the trench coat.  She's decked out in a saucy black leather S &M; outfit. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't think discipline will be a problem.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wow, Roz, don't you look smashing! _"Eve" --a young woman wearing a peach body stocking and a waist-length blonde wig--also notices Roz.  [N.B. Eve is played by Kelsey Grammer's real-life wife, Camille Donatacci Grammer] _

speaker: Eve
text: What an interesting costume!  Who are you?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm "O", from "The Story of 'O'".

speaker: Guests
text: Oh . . .

speaker: Roz
text: It's gonna be a long night.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think you look particularly lovely tonight.  There's a real glow about you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh no!  Oh God, not a glow! [_calms down_] I'm sorry, I'm just a little jumpy.  I had... kind of an accident, and I just haven't found out what the damage is yet.  Actually, I need to check my machine.  Do you know where a phone is?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, there's one at the top of the stairs.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Try not to worry.  A few years back, I got rear-ended.  Is that what happened to you?

speaker: Roz
text: Not exactly. Guy: Oh, hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi. Guy: Are you here alone?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, I hope so. _She goes up the stairs.  At the buffet, Martin is standing next to Gil, dressed as an Indian.  Gil tries a hors d'oeuvre._

speaker: Gil
text: Oh my!  What a delectable medley of fromagean splendor!  You must try one.

speaker: Martin
text: [_tries one_] Mmm, cheesy.

speaker: Gil
text: Mmm, yes.  "Cheesy"--the _mot juste_.  It must be glorious to have such a happy knack for clarity and concision.

speaker: Martin
text: Yep.  So who're you suppose to be?

speaker: Gil
text: Chingatchkook -- I'm the Last of the Mohicans!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!  Well... that little mystery solved. _Dissolve to: A While Later Frasier wanders around the room, looking for Roz.  He finds Daphne at the bar._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, have you seen Roz?

speaker: Daphne
text: Probably on the phone.  Seems like every fifteen minutes she's calling her machine again.  This little accident's got her pretty worried.

speaker: Frasier
text: She told you about it?

speaker: Niles
text: Champagne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not now, Niles.  Excuse us, we need a moment alone.

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz told me all about it.  It's no big deal.  Accidents happen even when you're being careful.  I had one myself a few years back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, really?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.  It was one of those real wham-bam numbers.  He was drunk and I wasn't paying attention...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: I called and called, but never got a penny out of him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I had no idea.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's not that bad.  For goodness' sake, back in Manchester, what with all those drunken louts out and about, it must have happened to me at least a dozen times.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I had no... really?  Well, of course nothing's certain until we get the pregnancy test results.

speaker: Daphne
text: Pregnancy?  We're not talking about a car accident, are we?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear.

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz is pregnant?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely not!  Where could you get such an insane notion?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you just said she was!

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up!  Or I'll smite you with the back of me sinewy -- oh, just get in here! _He drags her into the kitchen. Niles wanders the room looking for them.  He runs into Martin, who is busy demonstrating his magnifying glass to a pretty woman._

speaker: Niles
text: Did you notice where Frasier went?

speaker: Martin
text: No idea.

speaker: Niles
text: What about Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: Haven't a clue.

speaker: Niles
text: Holmes, you astound me. _In the kitchen, Frasier and Daphne are sitting at a small table. Daphne's eyes are getting increasingly teary._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I feel so guilty.  Roz swore me to secrecy.  I never should have said anything.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not your fault, you thought I knew.  Do you have a tissue?  These silly lashes are killing my eyes.  I must be allergic to the adhesive. _Frasier gives Daphne a handkerchief from his sleeve.  Behind his back, Niles cracks the door and eavesdrops._

speaker: Frasier
text: Just promise me you won't tell a soul.  We've got to keep this secret.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, right!  But we can't keep it a secret forever.  My God, we are talking about a baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how could I have been so careless?

speaker: Daphne
text: These things happen, it's not your fault.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know who'll get the blame if this ever gets out!

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry, I'll protect your reputation.  I'll tell everyone I forced you to it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  We'd better get back to the party before people start wondering about us. _Frasier gets up and swings the door open.  It thumps into something. The door swings back, showing Niles, whose prosthetic nose is now sticking up at a crazy angle._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles.  What's your nose all bent out of shape about? _Laughing, Frasier moves off into the crowd.  Niles glares after him.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **PANACHE** _Scene Four -- Party As Eve walks across the room, Frasier tracks her with his eyes. Niles comes up to him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's a literary "figure" I'd like to know better.

speaker: Niles
text: Just a moment, I need a word with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: What about?

speaker: Niles
text: Stay there, I've guests to greet.

speaker: Kids
text: Trick or treat!

speaker: Niles
text: How did you get past the doorman?

speaker: Dracula
text: We live in the building.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sorry, this isn't a good night for this.

speaker: Dracula
text: But it's Halloween!

speaker: Niles
text: Uh!  Very well! [_grabs an hors d'oeuvre tray from a maid_] Crab puff for you, and some gravlax for you, and pate for Dracula.  Now off you go! _He closes the door, hands the tray back, and goes back to Frasier, who is now talking to Eve._

speaker: Niles
text: I need to talk to you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Not now, Niles! [_to Eve_] Let me guess... Lady Godiva?

speaker: Eve
text: No, Eve -- from the Bible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now I know why they call it "The Good Book."

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing?  Are you just going to abandon Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, just because I gave her a ride doesn't mean I have to spend the whole evening with her! _The doorbell rings again, stifling Niles's outraged reply.  He goes back to the door and opens it to Bulldog, dressed as Waldo._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey!  Hey, get a load of that schnozzola!

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, wait, wait!  Guess who I am?

speaker: Niles
text: I give up.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm Waldo!  From "Where's Waldo?"  You know, that guy you can't find because he blends into the crowd?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, but I'd love a demonstration.

speaker: Frasier
text: And to think, all that time your cat was curled up in your sock drawer.  They're almost human, aren't they?

speaker: Niles
text: Pardon me, I need a word alone with my brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] Not now, Niles!  I'm doing really well here. This pointy hat is a babe magnet!

speaker: Niles
text: It's urgent!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just keep your voice down! [_to Eve_] I'm sorry, will you excuse me?

speaker: Eve
text: Sure, but hurry back.

speaker: Niles
text: Your boorish behavior is simply appalling!  I can no longer hold my tongue!

speaker: Frasier
text: Replace "tongue" with "liquor," and I'll believe you! You're drunk, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Drunk like a fox! [_looks around, then_] I know about the baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: You do?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Who told you?

speaker: Niles
text: I heard it from Daphne's own lips!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!  That blabbermouth!  I'll wring her neck!

speaker: Niles
text: Listen to yourself!  Have you no conscience?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're getting awfully exercised about this.

speaker: Niles
text: We're talking about a single woman with a baby!  What do you intend to do about it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose I could give her a raise!

speaker: Niles
text: That's your idea of responsibility?  Give her a raise?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you want me to do, marry her?  Let's look at something here, buddy, _she's_ the one that got pregnant! [_notices Roz standing next to them, glaring_] Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Beat it, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Stay here!

speaker: Roz
text: I am so mad at you I could scream!  How could you tell Niles about the baby?

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't!  Daphne told him, the damnable chatterbox!

speaker: Roz
text: And who told Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... that would be me! _Niles opens the door to two children wearing Halloween masks --Frankenstein and Alice in Wonderland. _

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  What is it with all you children, isn't it past your bedtime?! _"Frankenstein" takes off his mask --he's a midget. _

speaker: Krovitz
text: Dr. Crane, it's me, Dr. Krovitz.

speaker: Niles
text: [_recovering quickly_] Of course it is, and this must be your lovely wife Sylvia.

speaker: Krovitz
text: I don't know her.

speaker: Alice
text: Trick or treat! _Krovitz comes in.  Niles shuts the door in Alice's face.  Roz is still talking to Frasier._

speaker: Roz
text: What is wrong with you?  I specifically asked you not to tell anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Roz, but the way she spoke it sounded as if she already knew you were having a baby!

speaker: Martin
text: What, you are?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, great!  Nice going, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Roz, but he is the Master of Deduction!  He would have figured it out anyway! _Martin nods.  Roz storms away.  Niles is hovering next to Daphne, whose eyes are filled with tears again._

speaker: Niles
text: Just let it out.  I'm here for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I keep telling you, I'm not crying.  It's my damn lashes.

speaker: Niles
text: As courageous as you are beautiful.  Oh, you shouldn't be drinking this poison! [_takes her champagne glass, then notices Roz_] Here, Roz, drink this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz, do you have a tissue?

speaker: Roz
text: If you don't see it, I don't have it! [_calms down_] I'm sorry. Do you want to go get a cocktail napkin?

speaker: Niles
text: Hurry back, brave girl!  Oh, just look at her, poor thing.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I suppose you'll find out soon enough.  There's a baby on the way.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you know about that too?

speaker: Niles
text: Who told you?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I heard Frasier and Roz talking about it.

speaker: Niles
text: You don't seem very surprised.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, [_chuckles_] I mean I'm fond of her.  But let's face it, she's no Sunday school teacher.  She's been around the block a few times!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, instead of heaping scorn on her, you might put the blame where it belongs, on Frasier!  Look at him, the shameless Casanova!

speaker: Martin
text: What's Frasier got to do with this?

speaker: Niles
text: He's the father!

speaker: Martin
text: _What?!_  Are you kidding me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I heard it from his own mouth!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't believe it!  I've got to go talk to him!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait! [_words slightly slurred_] I've just made a montentous decision!  There's one person in this family who still has a sense of honor and decency.  Frasier may not be able to do right by that woman, but I will!

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm going to propose to her.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you nuts?  You're still married.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris never needed me.  But there's a woman here who does.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, I didn't know you even liked her.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I wore that mask well.  But now it's time to do the honorable thing!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you mean divorce your wife and marry the woman who's carrying your brother's child?

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused for a second, but_] I've made up my mind. Nothing's going to stop me, Dad!

speaker: Gil
text: Uh, excuse me, Niles.  I'm afraid there's been a bit of an hors d'oeuvre mishap on your Persian rug.  Just call me "Fumbles With Crab Puffs."

speaker: Niles
text: Not now, Gil. _In the kitchen, Daphne is dabbing her eyes again.  Roz pours herself a glass of milk._

speaker: Daphne
text: There's no use fretting until you know for sure.  God, my eyes are just getting worse.  I suppose I should ask Dr. Crane to take me home.  But I feel bad ruining his good time. I was having fun too--there are some very attractive men here!

speaker: Daphne
text: But who's going to want me in this condition?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, don't worry about Frasier.  He'll take care of you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_cackling drunkenly_] That's a laugh!  Beat it, Roz.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!

speaker: Roz
text: Never mind, I got to go check my machine. _Roz exits.  Niles, with some difficulty, kneels beside Daphne's chair._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, we've known each other for four years now, so I want to take the time to phrase this just right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, you take all the time you need.  I have to go find your brother. _She gets up and exits.  Niles cannot immediately do the same.  In the main room, Daphne taps Frasier on the shoulder._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, can I talk to you for a second?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Eve_] I'm sorry, will you excuse me?

speaker: Eve
text: It's all right.  I'll go freshen my lipstick.  I feel naked without it. _Frasier chuckles.  Eve moves off.  Frasier turns to Daphne.  Niles comes up behind her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Haven't you ruined my evening enough already?!

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am talking about you and your blabbermouth!  Niles told me you told him about the baby!

speaker: Daphne
text: I did not!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't play innocent with me!

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, I don't mean to ruin your evening, but I can't stay at the party like this.  Look at my eyes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, I am dreadfully sorry for your condition, Daphne, but it's your own fault!  You should have read the directions on the package before you used it!

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know why you're blaming this whole mess on me!  I just know I need a lift home right now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  But I am not leaving here until I get Eve's phone number.  So you can just sit down, have a drink, smoke a cigarette if you like!  I'm sorry, I am very attracted to this young woman, and I am not going to let you and your little problem stand in my way!

speaker: Niles
text: [_can take no more_] THAT'S ENOUGH!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, get your big nose out of this!  And lower your voice, you're embarrassing yourself!

speaker: Niles
text: The only thing I'm embarrassed about is that you're my brother!  You cad, you bounder, you _rou e!_

speaker: Frasier
text: What is so wrong about trying to get a woman's phone number?

speaker: Niles
text: We're not interested in your next conquest, we're talking about your last one!  And before you deny it, I have plenty of proof!

speaker: Frasier
text: From here, it smells like eighty proof!

speaker: Niles
text: A woman stands here before you in dire need...

speaker: Daphne
text: It's really not that bad.  I can find someone else who'll take me.

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed you can.

speaker: Martin
text: [_realizing what he thinks_] Niles--

speaker: Niles
text: I told you, don't try to stop me! [_to Frasier_] You have the audacity to seduce this poor woman, and then you aren't man enough to stand by her?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, before you make a complete ass of yourself--

speaker: Niles
text: Stop, or I'll teach you a long overdue lesson in chivalry! _He draws his sword.  Unfortunately, the blade breaks off and he is left with just an empty handle.  Martin offers Niles his cane._

speaker: Daphne
text: But, Dr. Crane--

speaker: Niles
text: No, no!  No, don't defend him! [_takes off his hat and kneels in front of Daphne, taking her hand_] There may be one bastard in this family, but as long as I have anything to say about it, your baby won't be another.  Daphne... will you marry me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, you drunken imbecile!  Daphne's not the one that's pregnant, _Roz_ is!

speaker: Niles
text: [_derailed_] _Roz_ is?

speaker: Eve
text: Who's Roz?

speaker: Bulldog
text: She's the one dressed like "O."

speaker: Guests
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: That was very gallant, Dr. Crane.  Perhaps you should propose to Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: If anybody's gonna propose to Roz, it's Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: How could you do that?  Get her pregnant?

speaker: Gil
text: It was Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Listen, everybody, I am not the father of Roz's baby!

speaker: Frasier
text: In fact, we don't even know for sure if there IS a baby!
